Nerangs.ab: Neyrang-e urwarān čidan ParagnaLL4.1.1 Var. a (Mss. K7, RJ):

avval nirang urvarān čidan mašrabe-ye āb va fanām va kārd va barsom-čin piš-e deraḫt-e urvarān šodan wa fanām bastan xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vōhū yek guftan va biḫ-e deraḫt-e urwarān pāk kardan va dast va kārd va biḫ-e urwarān b-āb-e pādyāvi pāk šostan dovvom bār-e digar xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ ašəm vohū yek ḫᵛāndan dast va biḫ-e urvarān b-āb-e bādyāvi šostan va seivom bār-e digar xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ ašəm vohū yek guftan va kārd va biḫ-e urwarān be-āb pādyāvi šostan

"First, the instruction for cutting the urvarān. He should go to the tree of the urvarān (pomegranate) (bringing) a watter vessel, the padām, knife and the barsom-čin and bind the padām. He should recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. He should purify a branch (?) of the urvarān-tree and wash the hand, the knife and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water. Second, he should recite another time xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and wash the hand and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water. Third, he should recite another time xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and wash the knife and the branch of the urvarān with pādyāvi-water."

urvarām čidan naḫost pāy-e urvarām ḫāli kardan va āb-e pādyāv kardan va urvarām šostan xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vōhū yek goftan va digar bār āb pādyāv kardan va dast va kārd va urvarām be pādyāv kardan va urvarām tarāšidan va and kas sar-e urvarān bar dāštan va sedigar bār ḫšnautra ahurahe mazdā ašem vohi yek goftan va āb pādyāv kardan va dast va kārd va urvarām šostan

"The cutting of the urvarām. First, he should do the foot (of the plant) empty, prepare the pādyāv-water and wash the urvarām. He should recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. He should prepare another time the pādyāv-water, wash the hand, the knife and the urvarām with pādyāv, peel the urvarām and take everything that is on the urvarām. He should recite three additional times xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū. He should prepare the pādyāv-water and wash the hand, the knife and the urvarām."
